question: Question 1 Consider the following statements regarding the front-end and back-end of a compiler. S1: The front-end includes phases that are independent of the target hardware. S2: The back-end includes phases that are specific to the target hardware. S3: The back-end includes phases that are specific to the programming language used in the source code. Identify the CORRECT option.
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.B: Only S1 and S2 are TRUE.
options.C: S1, S2, and S3 are all TRUE.
options.D: Only S1 and S3 are TRUE.

question:
Question 3 Let SLLdel be a function that deletes a node in a singly-linked list given a pointer
to the node and a pointer to the head of the list. Similarly, let DLLdel be another
function that deletes a node in a doubly-linked list given a pointer to the node and
a pointer to the head of the list. Let n denote the number of nodes in each of the linked lists. Which one of the
following choices is TRUE about the worst-case time complexity of SLLdel and
DLLdel?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: SLLdel is O(1) and DLLdel is O(n)
options.B: Both SLLdel and DLLdel are O(log(n))
options.C: Both SLLdel and DLLdel are O(1)
options.D: SLLdel is O(n) and DLLdel is O(1)

question:
Question 10 An algorithm has to store several keys generated by an adversary in a hash
table. The adversary is malicious who tries to maximize the number of collisions.
Let [latex] k[/latex] be the number of keys, [latex] m[/latex] be the number of slots in the hash table, and [latex] k \gt m[/latex]. Which one of the following is the best hashing strategy to counteract the adversary?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: Division method, i.e., use the hash function [latex]h(k) = k\;  mod \; m[/latex]
options.B:
Multiplication method, i.e., use the hash function [latex] h(k) =  \left \lfloor m(kA -\left \lfloor kA \right \rfloor ) \right \rfloor[/latex], where
[latex]A[/latex] is a carefully chosen constant.
options.D: If [latex]k[/latex] is a prime number, use Division method. Otherwise, use Multiplication method

Question 24 A keyboard connected to a computer is used at a rate of 1 keystroke per second.

[latex] \mu s[/latex] to process the keystroke. Let [latex] T_1[/latex] denote the fraction of a second spent in polling
and processing a keystroke. In an alternative implementation, the system uses interrupts instead of polling.

interrupt and processing a keystroke. Let  [latex] T_2[/latex] denote the fraction of a second spent
in servicing the interrupt and processing a keystroke.
The ratio [latex] \frac{T_1}{T_2}[/latex]
is ______ . (Rounded off to one decimal place)

Question 30 Consider the pushdown automaton (PDA) [latex]P[/latex] below, which runs on the input alphabet [latex]\{a,b\}[/latex], has stack alphabet [latex] \{ \perp ,A\}[/latex], and has three states [latex] \{s,p,q\}[/latex], with [latex]s[/latex]  being
the start state. A transition from state [latex]u[/latex]  to state [latex]v[/latex] , labelled [latex]c/X/\gamma [/latex] , where [latex]c[/latex] is
an input symbol or , [latex]X[/latex] is a stack symbol, and [latex]\gamma [/latex] is a string of stack symbols,
represents the fact that in state  [latex]u[/latex], the PDA can read  [latex]c[/latex] from the input, with  [latex]X[/latex] on
the top of its stack, pop  [latex]X[/latex] from the stack, push in the string  [latex]\gamma [/latex] on the stack, and
go to state [latex]v[/latex]. In the initial configuration, the stack has only the symbol  [latex]\perp [/latex] in it.
The PDA accepts by empty stack. Which one of the following options correctly describes the language accepted by [latex]P[/latex]?

Question 36 Let A be a priority queue for maintaining a set of elements. Suppose A is
implemented using a max-heap data structure. The operation Extract-Max(A)
extracts and deletes the maximum element from A. The operation Insert(A,key)
inserts a new element key in A. The properties of a max-heap are preserved at the
end of each of these operations. When A contains n elements, which one of the following statements about the worst
case running time of these two operations is TRUE?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: Both Extract-Max(A) and Insert(A,key) run in O(1).
options.B: Both Extract-Max(A) and Insert(A,key) run in O(log(n)).
options.C: Extract-Max(A) runs in O(1) whereas Insert(A,key) runs in O(n).
options.D: Extract-Max(A) runs in O(1) whereas Insert(A,key) runs in O(log(n)).

solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

Question 39 Let [latex] f:A\rightarrow B[/latex] be an onto (or surjective) function, where [latex]A[/latex]  and [latex]B[/latex] are nonempty
sets. Define an equivalence relation [latex] \sim [/latex]  on the set [latex]A[/latex] as [latex] a_1\sim a_2 \text{ if } f(a_1)=f(a_2),[/latex] where [latex] a_1, a_2  \in A[/latex] . Let [latex] \varepsilon =\{[x]:x \in A\}[/latex]  be the set of all the equivalence classes
under [latex] \sim [/latex]. Define a new mapping [latex] F: \varepsilon \rightarrow B[/latex]  as [latex]F([x]) = f(x),[/latex] for all the equivalence classes [latex][x][/latex] in [latex]  \varepsilon[/latex] Which of the following statements is/are TRUE?

options.B: F is an onto (or surjective) function.
options.C: F is a one-to-one (or injective) function.

question: Question 41 Let [latex]X[/latex] be a set and [latex]2^X[/latex] denote the powerset of [latex]X[/latex]. Define a binary operation [latex] \Delta [/latex] on [latex]2^X[/latex] as follows: [latex]A  \Delta B=(A-B) \cup (B-A)[/latex] Let [latex] H=(2^X,\Delta ) [/latex]. Which of the following statements about [latex]H[/latex] is/are correct?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.B: Every element in [latex]H[/latex] has an inverse, but [latex]H[/latex] is NOT a group.
options.C: For every [latex]A \in 2^X[/latex], the inverse of [latex]A[/latex] is the complement of [latex]A[/latex].
options.D: For every [latex]A \in 2^X[/latex], the inverse of [latex]A[/latex] is [latex]A[/latex].

question:
Question 42 Suppose in a web browser, you click on the www.gate-2023.in URL. The browser
cache is empty. The IP address for this URL is not cached in your local host, so
a DNS lookup is triggered (by the local DNS server deployed on your local host)
over the 3-tier DNS hierarchy in an iterative mode. No resource records are cached
anywhere across all DNS servers. Let RTT denote the round trip time between your local host and DNS servers
in the DNS hierarchy. The round trip time between the local host and the web
server hosting www.gate-2023.in is also equal to RTT. The HTML file associated
with the URL is small enough to have negligible transmission time and negligible
rendering time by your web browser, which references 10 equally small objects on
the same web server. Which of the following statements is/are CORRECT about the minimum elapsed
time between clicking on the URL and your browser fully rendering it?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: 7 RTTs, in case of non-persistent HTTP with 5 parallel TCP connections.
options.B: 5 RTTs, in case of persistent HTTP with pipelining.
options.C: 9 RTTs, in case of non-persistent HTTP with 5 parallel TCP connections.
options.D: 6 RTTs, in case of persistent HTTP with pipelining.

Question 45 Let [latex]G[/latex] be a simple, finite, undirected graph with vertex set [latex] \{v_1,...,v_n\}[/latex]. Let [latex] \Delta (G)[/latex]  
denote the maximum degree of  [latex]G[/latex] and let [latex] N=\{1,2,...\} [/latex]  denote the set of all possible
colors. Color the vertices of  [latex]G[/latex] using the following greedy strategy:
for [latex]i = 1,...,n[/latex] [latex]color(v_i)\leftarrow min\{ j \in N: \text{  no neighbour of } v_i \text{ is colored } j\}[/latex] Which of the following statements is/are TRUE?

options.A: This procedure results in a proper vertex coloring of [latex]G[/latex].
options.B: The number of colors used is at most [latex] \Delta (G)+1[/latex].
options.C: The number of colors used is at most[latex] \Delta (G)[/latex].
options.D: The number of colors used is equal to the chromatic number of [latex]G[/latex].

Question 50 Consider the syntax directed translation given by the following grammar and semantic rules. Here [latex]N, I, F \; and \; B[/latex] are non-terminals. [latex]N[/latex] is the starting non-terminal,
and [latex]\#,0 \; and \; 1[/latex] are lexical tokens corresponding to input letters [latex]"\#","0" \; and \; "1"[/latex],
respectively. [latex]X.val[/latex] denotes the synthesized attribute (a numeric value) associated
with a non-terminal [latex]X[/latex]. [latex]I_1[/latex] and [latex]F_1[/latex] denote occurrences of [latex]I[/latex] and [latex]F[/latex] on the right hand
side of a production, respectively. For the tokens [latex]0[/latex] and [latex]1[/latex], [latex]0.val=0[/latex] and [latex]1.val=1[/latex]. The value computed by the translation scheme for the input string [latex]\begin{aligned}
N & \rightarrow I \# F & N.val=I.val+F.val \\ 
I &\rightarrow I_1B & I.val = (2 I1.val) + B.val\\ 
I &\rightarrow B&I.val = B.val\\ 
F &\rightarrow BF_1& F.val = \frac{1}{2}(B.val + F1.val)\\ 
F &\rightarrow B&  F.val = \frac{1}{2} B.val\\ 
 B&\rightarrow 0& B.val = 0.val\\ 
B &\rightarrow 1&B.val = 1.val
\end{aligned} [/latex] [latex]10\# 011[/latex] is ____ (Rounded off to three decimal places)
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

question: Question 58 A series of natural numbers [latex]F_1,F_2,F_3,F_4,F_5,F_6,F_7,... [/latex]  obeys [latex]F_{n+1}=F_n+F_{n-1} [/latex]  for all integers [latex]n \geq 2[/latex]. If [latex]F_6=37[/latex], and [latex]F_7=60[/latex], then what is [latex]F_1[/latex]?

question:
Question 59 A survey for a certain year found that 90% of pregnant women received medical
care at least once before giving birth. Of these women, 60% received medical care
from doctors, while 40% received medical care from other healthcare providers. Given this information, which one of the following statements can be inferred with
certainty?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A:
More than half of the pregnant women received medical care at least once from a
doctor.
options.B:
Less than half of the pregnant women received medical care at least once from a
doctor.
options.C:
More than half of the pregnant women received medical care at most once from a
doctor.
options.D:
Less than half of the pregnant women received medical care at most once from a
doctor.

question:
Question 60 Looking at the surface of a smooth 3-dimensional object from the outside, which
one of the following options is TRUE?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: The surface of the object must be concave everywhere.
options.B: The surface of the object must be convex everywhere.
options.C: The surface of the object may be concave in some places and convex in other places.
options.D: The object can have edges, but no corners.

question:
Question 61 The country of Zombieland is in distress since more than 75% of its working
population is suffering from serious health issues. Studies conducted by competent
health experts concluded that a complete lack of physical exercise among its
working population was one of the leading causes of their health issues. As one of
the measures to address the problem, the Government of Zombieland has decided
to provide monetary incentives to those who ride bicycles to work. Based only on the information provided above, which one of the following
statements can be logically inferred with certainty?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A: All the working population of Zombieland will henceforth ride bicycles to work.
options.B:
Riding bicycles will ensure that all of the working population of Zombieland is free
of health issues.
options.C:
The health experts suggested to the Government of Zombieland to declare riding
bicycles as mandatory.
options.D:
The Government of Zombieland believes that riding bicycles is a form of physical
exercise.

question: Question 62 Consider two functions of time [latex](t)[/latex], [latex]f(t)=0.01t^2[/latex] [latex]g(t)=4t[/latex] where [latex]0 \lt t \lt \infty[/latex] Now consider the following two statements: (i) For some [latex] t \gt 0, g(t) \gt f(t)[/latex]. (ii) There exists a [latex]T[/latex], such that   [latex]f(t) \gt g(t)[/latex] for all [latex]t \gt T[/latex] . Which one of the following options is TRUE?

question:
Question 65 Which one of the options best describes the transformation of the 2-dimensional
figure P to Q, and then to R, as shown?
solution: Click here for detail solution by gateoverflow

options.A:
Operation 1: A clockwise rotation by [latex]90^{\circ} [/latex] about an axis perpendicular to the plane
of the figure Operation 2: A reflection along a horizontal line
options.B:
Operation 1: A counter clockwise rotation by [latex]90^{\circ} [/latex] about an axis perpendicular to
the plane of the figure Operation 2: A reflection along a horizontal line
options.C:
Operation 1: A clockwise rotation by [latex]90^{\circ} [/latex] about an axis perpendicular to the plane
of the figure Operation 2: A reflection along a vertical line
options.D:
Operation 1: A counter clockwise rotation by [latex]180^{\circ} [/latex] about an axis perpendicular to
the plane of the figure Operation 2: A reflection along a vertical line
